lines.text: Money won is twice as sweet as money earned.
You gotta have two things to win. You gotta have brains and you gotta have balls. Now, you got too much of one and not enough of the other.
The balls roll funny for everybody, kiddo.
Vincent, get in the car, this is embarrassing. You're acting like some girl who got felt up at the drive-in.
I'm not your daddy, I'm not your boyfriend, so don't be playing games with me. I'm your partner.

Nine-ball is rotation pool, the balls are pocketed in numbered order. The only ball that means anything, that wins it, is the 9. Now, the player can shoot eight trick shots in a row, blow the 9, and lose. On the other hand, the player can get the 9 in on the break, if the balls spread right, and win. Which is to say, that luck plays a part in nine-ball. But for some players, luck itself is an art.
You're some piece of work... You're also a natural character.

[to Carmen]
You see? I been tellin' her that. I got natural character.
That's not what I said, kid. I said you *are* a natural character; you're an incredible flake.
[Vincent's smile fades; Eddie continues]

But that's a *gift*. Some guys spend half their lives trying to invent something like that. You walk into a pool room with that go-go-go, the guys'll be *killing* each other, trying to get to you. You got that... But I'll tell you something, kiddo. You couldn't find Big Time if you had a road map.
How much did you take off Moselle? I heard a hundred...
One Fifty!

[sarcastically]
A hundred and fifty?
That's right, a hundred and fifty.
You walk into a shoe store with a hundred and fifty bucks, you come out with one shoe! We were working on five thousand!

[to Vincent]
I'll change my teeth, you change your god damned diapers!

This ain't pool. This is for bangers. Straight pool is pool. This is like hand-ball, or cribbage, or something. Straight pool, you gotta be a real surgeon to get 'em, you know? It's all finesse. Now, every thing is nine-ball, 'cause it's fast, good for T.V., good for a lot of break shots... Oh, well. What the hell. Checkers sells more than chess.
I think maybe the money's what's throwing you off here today.
It's even, but it ain't settled. Let's settle it.
You win one more game, you're gonna be humping your fist for a long time. Got that, Vincent?

[to Carmen about Vincent]
We got a racehorse here, a thoroughbred. You make him feel good, I teach him how to run!
You know what this is turning into?
What?
A waste of my time, and a waste of my money.
[Slams car door]
What? You're just gonna' leave me here?
[Eddie drives off]
I don't believe this guy!
[after challenging everyone in the bar to a game, offering to spot balls, give them break, pay if he loses but not be paid if he wins, etc]
Cowards! Off with their heads.
I can always go back to whiskey; it's been very good to me. I mean, you're sitting in it, and I'm wearing it.

[Eddie is pushing to go on the road]
This is my job, Eddie.
You think so? Hmmm. That's funny. I don't think so. I think it's your problem.
[last lines]
Hey Eddie, what are you going to do when I kick your ass?
Pick myself up and let you kick me again.
Oh yeah?
Yeah.
[pause]
Just don't put the money in the bank, kid. Because if I don't whip you now, I'm gonna whip you next month in Dallas.
You mean Houston - there's nothing coming up in Dallas.
Houston, Dallas... And if not then, then the month after that, in New Orleans.
Oh yeah? What makes you so sure?

[stares at Vincent for a second, then gets ready to break]
Hey - I'm back.
[Eddie breaks]
Did you ever hear of a hustle called Two Brothers and a Stranger?
Yeah, uh, that's the guy in the Bible with the many colored coats, right?
[grins widely; Eddie and Carmen look disgusted]
Hey, what's wrong with you guys? It's a joke, okay?

Did I get through to you last night, kiddo? 'Cause if I didn't, I'll run it by you another way. If you'd have kicked ass in any other place but Chalkie's, Atlantic City would be dead for us. The Guys Never Leave The Street. Otherwise, it'd be all around.
Do you smell that?
What, smoke?
No, Money...
I can always go back to whiskey, it's been very good to me.
Hey Grady. Up your ass with the spot. Is that OK with you?

[laughs]
That's fine by me.
Pool excellence is *not* about excellent pool.

[Eddie has just run the table]
Pretty damn good.
Not bad for a blind man. Rack 'em.
Yes sir, boss. Rack 'em up for Mr. Fast Eddie!
I haven't played serious pool since before you were born, and right off the bat, I'm layin' 'em to waste! Watch this. Nine on the break...
Human moves, kid. You study the watch... while I study you.

[to Eddie, after hustling him]
Hey, I want to ask you something, an' I want you to be real honest. Do you think I need to lose some weight?
Where's the Balabushka?
Vincent took it.
You said he was out.
He was in and out.
He took the cue stick?
Yes.
And you let him?
Well, so what?
Shit.
Oh, man, I'm sorry.
Jesus. Goddamn. Child care!
What you got in there?
In here?
[Opens case; smiles widely]
Doom.
Come on, boy. Let's play.
Yeah, let's play. We're gonna' have a lot of fun.
You know who you got stakehorsin' here for you? This here's Fast Eddie Felson. Who the hell are you? The end of the world?
